contest-event.event-date:
April 16, 1906 D Enfield Contest
Enfield Contest 0 Test Piece Contest
enfield-contest
None
Memories of Donizetti
Enfield, Middlesex 6 bands competed.
Details from Gravesend Reporter, North Kent and South Essex Advertiser - Saturday 21 April 1906 p5
1 Grays Temperance, 2 Enfield Town, 3 Northfleet conductor J Jackson, 4 St Albans City, 5 Luton Volunteers, 6 Sunbury (Gravesend and Willesden did not compete) Test piece - Memories of Donizetti (arr. Rimmer) Adjudicator Mr. J.O.Sheppard
This was the final contest of a season in connection with the Amateur Brass Band League. The final league table: 1 Enfield Town, 37 points 2 Northfleet, 31 3 Grays Temperance, 26 4 St. Albans, 25 5 Gravesend, 23 6 Willesden, 13 7 Luton Voulunteers, 8 8 Sunbury, 6 The winning band received a cup, to be held for one year, and medals for each of the players, while the runners up (Northfleet) were awarded medals.
Feb. 23, 2012, 4:02 p.m. April 5, 2020, 11:09 a.m.
1 Grays Town Band F. B. Gray
2 Enfield Band Fred Dimmock
3 Northfleet Brass Joseph Jackson
4 St. Albans City Fred Tingle
5 Sunbury W. Goodyer
6 Luton Volunteers W. Goodyer
